abstract: In a blog post, Mr. Woodford, formerly of Invesco, said he was concerned about the “unquantifiable” fines HSBC could face in continuing investigations by regulators.
snippet: In a blog post, Mr. Woodford, formerly of Invesco, said he was concerned about the “unquantifiable” fines HSBC could face in continuing investigations by regulators.
lead_paragraph: LONDON — Neil Woodford, an influential fund manager in Britain, said on Monday that he had sold his stake in the British bank HSBC over concerns about rapidly escalating fines by regulators in the banking industry.

headline.main: Fund Manager Neil Woodford Sells HSBC Stake on Risk of Fines
